summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 regarding the protocol for reviewing image and video files seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices. It involves coordination between FBI and USAO teams, assignment of specific devices for review, and references to reading the warrant, affidavit, and Maxwell indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The image/video file review is of devices seized from him. The protocol asks reviewers to read the warrant and supporting affidavit related to his case.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The Maxwell indictment is attached for reviewers, and it contains a photograph of Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: Referenced together in the Maxwell indictment, which contains a photograph of both.

events.title: Review Protocol Distribution
events.description: The image/video file review protocol for Epstein's devices is distributed to the review teams, including attachments of the warrant, supporting affidavit, and Maxwell indictment.

events.title: Device Review Coordination
events.description: Follow-up email sent to coordinate the device review, assign team members to specific devices, and schedule a call with AUSAs.

events.title: Confidentiality Query
events.description: An email query about whether screenshots of maps should be marked as confidential because they relate to travel.

keyFacts: There were ten specific devices (listed by NYC evidence numbers) seized from Epstein that required image/video file review by FBI and USAO teams.
Reviewers were instructed to read the warrant, supporting affidavit, and the Maxwell indictment as part of the review protocol.
The review was time-sensitive, with a completion target of the following Friday from the protocol distribution.
A question was raised about marking screenshots of maps as confidential due to their potential relation to travel.
